the Save Point.

showWindowWithDialog({window:3, dialog:27}); // I'll probably see you again somewhere
down the road.{PAUSE}Take care!

ops.js: fade({r:0, g:160, b:40, speed:64, type:6, adjust:0});
fade({r:0, g:160, b:40, speed:16, type:5, adjust:255});

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:12}); // {Cloud}
Don't mess with me. I used to be in SOLDIER.
I'll tell you how much I know
an' for free too!

ops.mr: Execute script #%3 in extern group %1 (priority %2/6) - Only if the script is not already running|_script(groupID)|priority|scriptID

ops.js:
showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:31}); // {Cloud}
I'm not hard up enough
to take money from guys like you.
But I'll rap with you for a while.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:47}); // {Cloud}
You've got to hang in there.
Your limit gauge is just starting to build.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:49}); // {Cloud}
OK! Now your limit gauge is full,
go ahead and use it!
Fight with your limit technique.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:51}); // {Cloud}
Calm down!
When your enemy uses magic
counter with [Magic Barrier] or [reflect].{PAUSE}[Magic Barrier] reduces the damage
received from magic by half.{PAUSE}[reflect] bounces the attacks off you.
But the number of times you can use it
is limited so be careful.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:54}); // {Cloud}
If you want to get as strong as me
you need to use Materia.{PAUSE}And you have to find the best combinations
of them.{PAUSE}The type of Materia you put in
your weapons and armor will determine
how quickly your Materia grows.{PAUSE}Put Materia into the open slots
in your weapons and armor.
The possible combinations are limitless.{PAUSE}That's about all I can tell you.
If you want to be like me, you have
to have some natural talent.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:56}); // {Cloud}
Listen kids, don't piss me off!{PAUSE}That's all right. Just give it a try.
Little by little, you'll get used to it.

showWindowWithDialog({window:0, dialog:62}); // {Cloud}
Huh? Finger!?
What the hell?

showWindowWithDialog({window:0, dialog:64}); // {Cloud}
Geez, you stand out even more than I do

But your eyes say you're not.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:15}); // You're a stingy one.
Here, I'll give you ONE Potion.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:16}); // I don't have any extra Potions on me.
Why don't you go buy some?

ops.js:
showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:18}); // {Cloud}
You probably know all this.
But just in case, I'll go over it.{PAUSE}Until you get instructions,
don't open or take discs
out of the CD drive.{PAUSE}After you open up the CD drive,
I can't guarantee what'll happen.
That's all.

ops.mr: Execute script #%3 in extern group %1 (priority %2/6) - Only if the script is not already running|_script(groupID)|priority|scriptID

ops.js:
showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:2}); // Unn!!
Who the hell are you!?
No unauthorized access.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:7}); // Since today's special,
I'm gonna let you in on a juicy bit of news.
But you gotta keep it to yourself.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:4}); // You must be sick of hearing it
But it's been so long
since there was any real news here.{PAUSE}You're worried where it's all heading, right?

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:5}); // Everyone's in a buzz 'bout that
terrorist group AVALANCHE
blowin' up the Sector 1 Mako Reactor.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:6}); // On the surface they say
they're an anti-Shinra group,
but in reality{PAUSE}they say they're just out to kill
as many people as they can.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:8}); // Haaa, haaa, haaa!!{PAUSE}That's a good one, ain't it!?
While they're bustin' things up on top,
the only ones makin' out
good are us weapon stores!{PAUSE}Now, if we can just get rid of this back stock,
we'll be doin' OK.

showWindowWithDialog({window:2, dialog:10}); // You know what I do?
I'll bet you don't.{PAUSE}You come here tomorrow and I'll tell you.{PAUSE}Ahh, there just ain't no good jobs
here in the slums.{PAUSE}I wanna go to the upper world.

showWindowWithDialog({window:2, dialog:23}); // Hey!!
You got one right off!{PAUSE}That was Materia.
Next, take this [treasure chest]!

showWindowWithDialog({window:2, dialog:24}); // Now listen,
hidden in these treasure chests
are a lot of items.{PAUSE}There are box types and bag types,
so make sure you don't overlook any.

ops.js:
showWindowWithDialog({window:0, dialog:59}); // [Directional button] [CONTROL]
up{CHOICE}{CHOICE}{CHOICE} {PURPLE}[MENU]{WHITE}: menu
left right: walk {CHOICE}{PURPLE}[OK]{WHITE}: speak/execute
down{CHOICE}{CHOICE} {PURPLE}[CANCEL]{WHITE}: run

showWindowWithDialog({window:0, dialog:61}); // [How to restart]
You must quit the game in order to restart.
To quit the game, either select QUIT
in the Main Menu or press CTRL+Q.

showWindowWithDialog({window:0, dialog:63}); // I'm the position cursor!!
Call me whenever you're walking
around confused!{PAUSE}Push {PURPLE}[ASSIST]{WHITE}
and I'll appear over your shiny little head.

showWindowWithDialog({window:0, dialog:65}); // Am I in the way?
If so, just push {PURPLE}[ASSIST]{WHITE}
one more time.{PAUSE}I'm pretty busy myself,
and can't always come when you need me.
If I don't show up sometimes, don't get mad.{PAUSE}Later!

showWindowWithDialog({window:3, dialog:66}); // [Position Cursor]
Push {PURPLE}[ASSIST]{WHITE}
when you're lost in the field.
Usually, the {CYAN}[Position Cursor]{WHITE} will
appear on the screen.{PAUSE}But wait!!
{RED}[Red triangles]{WHITE} mark the exits and
{GREEN}[Green triangles]{WHITE} mark ladders.
These will help you safely make it through even
the darkest streets or dangerous mountains!{PAUSE}But, there are times when they won't appear,
so be careful.

ops.js:
showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:25}); // This is the fabled [Save Point]!!{PAUSE}At a [Save Point]
you can use a [tent] and/or select 'SAVE'.{PAUSE}You can also do something else
there, but right now it's a secret.{PAUSE}Even if you are wiped out, if you've
saved, you can restart
from that same point.{PAUSE}That way you don't have to worry
when you've been wiped out.{PAUSE}This is jumping ahead a little but,
when you leave Midgar{PAUSE}and you get to the world map,
you can save anywhere you like.
Remember that.

ops.js:
showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:29}); // Hey SOLDIER!!
Tell us about battles!
We'll even pay you!

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:32}); // {Cloud}
ATB or Active Time Battle is a system
that is always in operation during battle.{PAUSE}Select [Wait] from ATB on the Config Menu
and time will stop
when you select magic or items during battle.{PAUSE}This gives you time to pick out your commands.
This is especially helpful to beginners.{PAUSE}Selecting [Recommended] ATB
in the config menu can stop time
while the effects of spells and items are
taking place during battle.{PAUSE}This lets you take your time looking over
the progression of the battle.
When you don't want to rush in battle,
this is for you!{PAUSE}Personally, I always use [Active],
but you can use whichever you like.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:33}); // {Cloud}
White numbers appearing on the screen
in battle are damage points.
Green numbers show restorative points.{PAUSE}You better watch these
if you don't want to get wiped out.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:34}); // {Cloud}
The [Change] command can move characters
to and from the front and back rows.{PAUSE}In the back row, the damage received is less,
but the attacking power is less.{PAUSE}You can make a [Change]
by pressing the Directional button in battle.{PAUSE}Pushing the Directional button
the other direction during battle
accesses [Defend].{PAUSE}Selecting [Defend] reduces the damage
you receive by half
until the next command.{PAUSE}If you're up against a strong enemy,
don't hesitate to use this one.
Of course, I never need it.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:35}); // {Cloud}
I don't really remember ever having
to use the [Escape] command
but you'll probably need it.{PAUSE}Push {PURPLE}[PAGEUP]{WHITE} and {PURPLE}[PAGEDOWN]{WHITE} together,
hold them down, and you can escape.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:36}); // {Cloud}
During battle,
there are several [Gauges] displayed.
You can't check them now,
so just remember what I tell you.{PAUSE}[time gauge] displays the time
remaining until your
next turn while in battle.{PAUSE}When the gauge is full,
you can make your command.{PAUSE}If you don't want to make one,
push {PURPLE}[MENU]{WHITE}
and you can move to
the next character.{PAUSE}It's convenient when you wanna make
{Barret} work.{PAUSE}The [limit gauge] increases every time
you sustain damage.
When it is full,
you can use the [limit technique].{PAUSE}This gauge is not cleared after each battle,
but gradually builds up over time.{PAUSE}It takes a while for it to build up,
so you have to think about which
times are the best to use it.{PAUSE}You probably don't know about them,
but there are conditions of
[fury] and [sadness].{PAUSE}When you have [fury],
your limit gauge builds up sooner,
but your attacking accuracy is lower.{PAUSE}Keep in mind that [sadness] makes
your limit gauge build up slower,
but the damage you receive is also less

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:39}); // {Cloud}
[Status] means just that.
The status of each character.{PAUSE}I'll probably wind up repeating myself,
but let me go over a few basic points.

showWindowWithDialog({window:0, dialog:40}); // Sleep
You cannot put in a command
until you get up.{PAUSE}Poison
Steals your HP in battle.{PAUSE}Fury
Damage is increased,
attack accuracy decreased.
Tranquilizers will remedy it.{PAUSE}Sadness
Damage is decreased.
Hyper will remedy it.{PAUSE}Petrify
Will petrify and become immobilized.
Every member will be wiped out.{PAUSE}Confuse
Will attack enemy and ally alike.{PAUSE}Silence
Will be unable to cast magic.{PAUSE}Paralyze
Stops time gauges, commands.{PAUSE}Darkness
Accuracy of hitting attacks decreases.{PAUSE}Frog
Become a frog. I hate this one!

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:41}); // {Cloud}
HooI'm beat.{PAUSE}Your [Status] can be changed with magic
and items, so you should check
it whenever you buy things.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:42}); // {Cloud}
[elemental] is the special effect that
comes with certain weapons and magic.{PAUSE}It's necessary to move ahead effectively.
If you pay attention to
the types of elementals you use
you'll become intermediate in no time.{PAUSE}I put together this list,
but remember, it's just a partial list
don't take it too literally.

showWindowWithDialog({window:0, dialog:43}); // Fire
Fire effect. Works best on animals
and water monsters.{PAUSE}Ice
Ice effect. Works best on fire monsters
and things that hate the cold.{PAUSE}Lightning
Lightning effect.
Works best on mechanical things.{PAUSE}Earth
Attacks using the earth's power.
Doesn't work on flying enemies.{PAUSE}Poison
Poisons enemies. Doesn't work on
any poison-based enemies.{PAUSE}Gravity
Gravity-based attack.
These hurt if they hit.{PAUSE}Water
Calls on the earth's water.
Works well on fire monsters.{PAUSE}Wind
Calls up the winds.
Works well on flying enemies.{PAUSE}Holy
Calls up the Planet's power.
Works well on dark monsters.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:44}); // {Cloud}
If you use reciprocal elementals
in your attacks, the effect is huge!{PAUSE}Also, if you use the same elemental,
your defenses are raised.
But, you have to be careful
because the opposite is also true.{PAUSE}To see what elementals an enemy has,
you need [Sense] Materia.
If you get that Materia,
you should try using it.

showWindowWithDialog({window:1, dialog:37}); // {Cloud}
Looks like you didn't get it
the last time I told you.
What's wrong with you?
You touched in the head?{PAUSE}Well, don't worry.
You just need to push {PURPLE}[ASSIST]{WHITE}
in battle.{PAUSE}Do that, and the [Help] message will walk you
through the commands.{PAUSE}It also shows you the name of your enemy,
so even I use it once in a while.
Make good use of it.

dialogStrings: Sector 7 Slums
Beginner's Hall

Unn!!
Who the hell are you!?
No unauthorized access.

Do you know about what's been going on?
{CHOICE}What, that again?
{CHOICE}

You must be sick of hearing it
But it's been so long
since there was any real news here.{PAUSE}You're worried where it's all heading, right?

Everyone's in a buzz 'bout that
terrorist group AVALANCHE
blowin' up the Sector 1 Mako Reactor.

On the surface they say
they're an anti-Shinra group,
but in reality{PAUSE}they say they're just out to kill
as many people as they can.

Since today's special,
I'm gonna let you in on a juicy bit of news.
But you gotta keep it to yourself.

Haaa, haaa, haaa!!{PAUSE}That's a good one, ain't it!?
While they're bustin' things up on top,
the only ones makin' out
good are us weapon stores!{PAUSE}Now, if we can just get rid of this back stock,
we'll be doin' OK.

I welcome everything going to pot!{PAUSE}GO!! GO!! AVALANCHE!!
That's what I say!

You know what I do?
I'll bet you don't.{PAUSE}You come here tomorrow and I'll tell you.{PAUSE}Ahh, there just ain't no good jobs
here in the slums.{PAUSE}I wanna go to the upper world.

This is the Beginner's Hall.{PAUSE}You say you're a beginner?
But your eyes say you're not.

{Cloud}
Don't mess with me. I used to be in SOLDIER.
I'll tell you how much I know
an' for free too!

{Cloud}
What do you want to know?
{CHOICE}How to save?
{CHOICE}How to heal your allies?
{CHOICE}Curative Magic?
{CHOICE}Weapons and armor?
{CHOICE}How to apply Materia?
{CHOICE}Effective ways to use Materia?
{CHOICE}How to form your battle party?
{CHOICE}How to check your status?
{CHOICE}About Limit status?
{CHOICE}Other things to watch for?
{CHOICE}That's all

{Cloud}
First, you need Potions.

You're a stingy one.
Here, I'll give you ONE Potion.

I don't have any extra Potions on me.
Why don't you go buy some?

{Cloud}
Sorry.
I'll have to go get my money.

{Cloud}
You probably know all this.
But just in case, I'll go over it.{PAUSE}Until you get instructions,
don't open or take discs
out of the CD drive.{PAUSE}After you open up the CD drive,
I can't guarantee what'll happen.
That's all.

You cannot take on any more Materia.
Please discard some Materia.
Received "All" Materia!

[Save Point]
Access the menu and select
{PURPLE}[SAVE]{WHITE} to save your game.
Received "Ether"!

Hey!!
You got one right off!{PAUSE}That was Materia.
Next, take this [treasure chest]!

Now listen,
hidden in these treasure chests
are a lot of items.{PAUSE}There are box types and bag types,
so make sure you don't overlook any.

This is the fabled [Save Point]!!{PAUSE}At a [Save Point]
you can use a [tent] and/or select 'SAVE'.{PAUSE}You can also do something else
there, but right now it's a secret.{PAUSE}Even if you are wiped out, if you've
saved, you can restart
from that same point.{PAUSE}That way you don't have to worry
when you've been wiped out.{PAUSE}This is jumping ahead a little but,
when you leave Midgar{PAUSE}and you get to the world map,
you can save anywhere you like.
Remember that.

That should be all you need to know about
the Save Point.

I'll probably see you again somewhere
down the road.{PAUSE}Take care!

I'm a [treasure chest]!!
Beginners, make sure and keep an eye out for me!!

Hey SOLDIER!!
Tell us about battles!
We'll even pay you!

{Cloud}
What do you want to know?
{CHOICE}About ATB
{CHOICE}About numbers on the screen
{CHOICE}About [Change] and [Defend]
{CHOICE}About [Escape]
{CHOICE}About [Gauges]
{CHOICE}About [Status]
{CHOICE}About [Elementals]
{CHOICE}About [Help]
{CHOICE}That's all the time I have for you!

{Cloud}
I'm not hard up enough
to take money from guys like you.
But I'll rap with you for a while.

{Cloud}
ATB or Active Time Battle is a system
that is always in operation during battle.{PAUSE}Select [Wait] from ATB on the Config Menu
and time will stop
when you select magic or items during battle.{PAUSE}This gives you time to pick out your commands.
This is especially helpful to beginners.{PAUSE}Selecting [Recommended] ATB
in the config menu can stop time
while the effects of spells and items are
taking place during battle.{PAUSE}This lets you take your time looking over
the progression of the battle.
When you don't want to rush in battle,
this is for you!{PAUSE}Personally, I always use [Active],
but you can use whichever you like.

{Cloud}
White numbers appearing on the screen
in battle are damage points.
Green numbers show restorative points.{PAUSE}You better watch these
if you don't want to get wiped out.

{Cloud}
The [Change] command can move characters
to and from the front and back rows.{PAUSE}In the back row, the damage received is less,
but the attacking power is less.{PAUSE}You can make a [Change]
by pressing the Directional button in battle.{PAUSE}Pushing the Directional button
the other direction during battle
accesses [Defend].{PAUSE}Selecting [Defend] reduces the damage
you receive by half
until the next command.{PAUSE}If you're up against a strong enemy,
don't hesitate to use this one.
Of course, I never need it.

{Cloud}
I don't really remember ever having
to use the [Escape] command

During battle,

but the damage you receive is also less

[Status] means just that.
The status of each character.{PAUSE}I'll probably wind up repeating myself,

Sleep
You cannot put in a command
until you get up.{PAUSE}Poison
Steals your HP in battle.{PAUSE}Fury
Damage is increased,
attack accuracy decreased.
Tranquilizers will remedy it.{PAUSE}Sadness
Damage is decreased.
Hyper will remedy it.{PAUSE}Petrify
Will petrify and become immobilized.
Every member will be wiped out.{PAUSE}Confuse
Will attack enemy and ally alike.{PAUSE}Silence
Will be unable to cast magic.{PAUSE}Paralyze
Stops time gauges, commands.{PAUSE}Darkness
Accuracy of hitting attacks decreases.{PAUSE}Frog
Become a frog. I hate this one!

HooI'm beat.{PAUSE}Your [Status] can be changed with magic

{Cloud}
[elemental] is the special effect that
comes with certain weapons and magic.{PAUSE}It's necessary to move ahead effectively.
If you pay attention to
the types of elementals you use
you'll become intermediate in no time.{PAUSE}I put together this list,
but remember, it's just a partial list
don't take it too literally.

Fire
Fire effect. Works best on animals
and water monsters.{PAUSE}Ice
Ice effect. Works best on fire monsters
and things that hate the cold.{PAUSE}Lightning
Lightning effect.
Works best on mechanical things.{PAUSE}Earth
Attacks using the earth's power.
Doesn't work on flying enemies.{PAUSE}Poison
Poisons enemies. Doesn't work on
any poison-based enemies.{PAUSE}Gravity
Gravity-based attack.
These hurt if they hit.{PAUSE}Water
Calls on the earth's water.
Works well on fire monsters.{PAUSE}Wind
Calls up the winds.
Works well on flying enemies.{PAUSE}Holy
Calls up the Planet's power.
Works well on dark monsters.

{Cloud}
If you use reciprocal elementals

Great!
How to use the buttons.

[Directional button] [CONTROL]
up{CHOICE}{CHOICE}{CHOICE} {PURPLE}[MENU]{WHITE}: menu
left right: walk {CHOICE}{PURPLE}[OK]{WHITE}: speak/execute
down{CHOICE}{CHOICE} {PURPLE}[CANCEL]{WHITE}: run
<fe>{PURPLE}[PAGEUP]<fe>{WHITE}/<fe>{PURPLE}[PAGEDOWN]<fe>{WHITE}: turn.

[How to restart]
You must quit the game in order to restart.
To quit the game, either select QUIT
in the Main Menu or press CTRL+Q.

[Position Cursor]
Push {PURPLE}[ASSIST]{WHITE}
when you're lost in the field.
Usually, the {CYAN}[Position Cursor]{WHITE} will
appear on the screen.{PAUSE}But wait!!
{RED}[Red triangles]{WHITE} mark the exits and
{GREEN}[Green triangles]{WHITE} mark ladders.
These will help you safely make it through even
the darkest streets or dangerous mountains!{PAUSE}But, there are times when they won't appear,
so be careful.
